required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chemotherapy With Pemetrexed in Combination With Platinum for Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Phase 2 Study of Pemetrexed in Combination With Cisplatin or Carboplatin in the First Line Therapy of Advanced NSCLC

brief_summary.textblock: This is a two-arm, parallel, open-label, Phase 2 multicenter study of pemetrexed as first line combination therapy with either cisplatin or carboplatin in the palliative setting of stage IIIb and IV non-small cell lung cancer patients. Approximately 130 patients will be included in about 15 centers in Germany and randomized to one of the above treatment regimens in a 1:1 ratio. Chemotherapy will be administered over a maximum of six cycles with a standard length of 21 days. Primary objective will be the Progression Free Survival Time of patients as assessed in both treatment arms.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Surviving Progression-Free at 6 Months (Progression Free Survival [PFS] Rate)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to date of death from any cause (up to 1 year)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Tumor Response (as Basis for Response Rate)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks for 6 months during the treatment period, and every 3 months during the follow-up period, until disease progression
Randomization to stopping of treatment, progression, death or initiation of further chemotherapy, whichever occurs first (up to 1 year)
Every 21-day cycle for up to 6 cycles

intervention.description: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles
75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles
Area under the concentration curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cytologically and/or histologically confirmed NSCLC Stage IIIb or IV
- No previous systemic chemotherapy for this cancer
- At least one uni-dimensionally measurable lesion meeting Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance status of 0 or 1 and adequate organ function
- Prior radiation therapy allowed but limited to <25% of the patient's bone marrow
Exclusion Criteria:
- Serious concomitant systemic disorder or active infection
- Mild to moderate renal insufficiency, but unable to interrupt salicylates or other nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs
- Symptomatic central nervous system (CNS) metastases requiring concurrent corticosteroid therapy
- Presence of clinically significant third-space fluid collections

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 136 patients signed informed consent. Of these, 3 patients were discontinued prior to randomization (1x protocol entry criteria not met, 2x patient decision); 133 patients were randomized, 130 patients started study drug.

group.description: Pemetrexed 500 mg/m2 intravenous (IV); Cisplatin 75 mg/m2 IV, every 21 days for 6 cycles

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: Pemetrexed 500 mg/m2 intravenous (IV); Carboplatin area under the concentration curve (AUC) 5 IV, every 21 days for 6 cycles

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status
measure.description: Classifies patients according to their functional impairment. Scores range from 0 (Fully Active) to 5 (Death).

measure.description: Presents specifically participants with bone and brain metastases

measure.title: Use of Tobacco Products
measure.description: For past and current smokers only: N=56 for Pemetrexed + Cisplatin, N=58 for Pemetrexed + Carboplatin:

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Surviving Progression-Free at 6 Months (Progression Free Survival [PFS] Rate)
outcome.description: For this study, we used the exponential distribution (assumption done for the calculation of the sample size) to estimate the PFS rate. The PFS rate (%) and the 95% confidence intervals were calculated based on the following formula: exp(-6 Œª) ¬± 1.96 * exp(-6 Œª) * (-6 Œª)/‚àör. Where Œª was calculated based on the Maximum-Likelihood estimator for ln(Œª) as given by (Collett 2003): ln(Œª) = ln[ r / ‚àëti ] with r = number of patients with events up to 6 months, ti = survival time of patient i (i=1,‚Ä¶,n), event or censored up to 6 months, and n= total number of patients per treatment group.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set: All patients randomized who received at least one dose of study drug

Where Œª was calculated based on the Maximum-Likelihood estimator for ln(Œª) as given by (Collett 2003): ln(Œª) = ln[ r / ‚àëti ] with r = number of patients with events up to 6 months, ti = survival time of patient i (i=1,‚Ä¶,n), event or censored up to 6 months, and n= total number of patients per treatment group.

measure.title: Overall Survival
measure.description: Defined as the time from randomization to the date of death from any cause.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set: All patients randomized who received at least one dose of study drug

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Tumor Response (as Basis for Response Rate)
outcome.description: Best overall response was evaluated using RECIST Criteria which define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stabilize"), or worsen ("progression") during treatment. CR: complete response, disappearance of all target lesions; PR: partial response, 30% decrease in sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; PD: progressive disease, 20% increase in sum of the longest diameter of target lesions; SD: stable disease, small changes not meeting above criteria. Response Rate: number of participants with response(CR+PR)per total population, multiplied by 100 to give a percentage.
outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks for 6 months during the treatment period, and every 3 months during the follow-up period, until disease progression
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set: All patients randomized who received at least one dose of study drug

outcome.title: Pharmacology Toxicities
outcome.description: Number of patients experiencing Grade 3 or 4 hematologic and non-hematologic adverse events (AEs) possibly related to study drug or protocol procedures in this study (a subset of those listed in the AE Module). AEs were graded using the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events version 3.0 (CTCAE v3.0) for defining and grading specific adverse events. A grading (severity) scale is provided for each adverse event term. Grades range from 0 (none) to 5 (death). Grade 3 AEs are severe and undesirable; Grade 4 AEs are life-threatening or disabling.
outcome.time_frame: Every 21-day cycle for up to 6 cycles
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set: All patients randomized who received at least one dose of study drug

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
